0.title: He's scared to face PM Modi: BJP as KCR skips PM's welcome at airport
0.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport, BJP MLC N Ramchander Rao said that KCR is scared to face the PM. Meanwhile, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "[KCR] has insulted the institution of both...a CM and PM." Notably, PM Modi arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday.

1.title: Jannik, I are some of the youngest players left in Wimbledon draw: Alcaraz
1.article_body: Following his third round win at Wimbledon 2022, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said he and his fourth round opponent, 20-year-old Jannik Sinner, are some of the youngest players left in the draw currently. "Maybe the most talented. But there are a lot of other young guys who play incredibly well," he added. Alcaraz and Sinner are seeded fifth and 10th respectively.

2.title: Mainstream cinema is boring, all actors are interchangeable: Harsh Varrdhan
2.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has stated that he sees the same repackaged and rehashed version of films in mainstream cinema, adding he finds them really boring. "[I] feel all actors are interchangeable in that format," he said. The actor further said that his 'Bhavesh Joshi Superhero' and 'Thar' stand out because they make very little compromise in terms of creativity.

3.title: PM Modi only believes in confrontation: Opposition's Prez candidate
3.article_body: Opposition's candidate for Presidential elections, Yashwant Sinha, on Saturday said PM Narendra Modi never believed in "consensus" but only "confrontation". He said the elections are being held under "extraordinary circumstances", adding that it is not a fight between two individuals but a battle of ideologies. Notably, BJP-led NDA has announced Draupadi Murmu's name as its Presidential candidate.

4.title: Kolkata Police issues lookout circular against Nupur Sharma
4.article_body: Kolkata Police on Saturday issued a lookout circular against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. According to police, the circular was issued as Sharma reportedly failed to turn up after she was sent two notices for appearance for interrogation. Last month, widespread violence broke out in several districts over Sharma's remarks.

5.title: Veterinary doctor provoked others to murder Amravati man for supporting Nupur: Police
5.article_body: A 44-year-old veterinary doctor, identified as Yusuf Khan Bahadur Khan, had provoked others to murder Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe who was stabbed to death, police have said. Kolhe was killed for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police stated. "Khan had made a post on a WhatsApp group against Kolhe...This provoked the accused...and they decided to murder him," they added.

6.title: Why is July 2 celebrated as World UFO Day?
6.article_body: World UFO Day, celebrated on July 2, commemorates two days which are first widely reported UFO sightings. First sighting was reported on June 24, 1947, when aviator Kenneth Arnold claimed he saw a 'flying saucer'. Second incident was in New Mexico on July 2, when a ranch owner found debris around his pasture, believed to have fallen from UFO crash.

7.title: If you disagree, close your account: UK bank to customers upset by pronoun badges
7.article_body: UK-based Halifax has said that customers objecting to the company's decision to allow employees to display their pronouns on name badges can close their accounts. The controversy started after Halifax tweeted a picture of a name badge saying "Gemma (she/her/hers)", along with the caption, "Pronouns matter". Halifax said, "If you disagree with our values, you're welcome to close your account."

8.title: Telangana CM skips PM Modi's welcome at airport for the 3rd time, triggers row
8.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at the airport as the latter arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday. Notably, this is the third time that Rao has skipped PM Modi's welcome ceremony this year. It triggered a political row in the state with BJP criticising the CM's actions.

9.title: UK MP under investigation for sexual misconduct; suspended
9.article_body: Senior UK Parliamentarian Chris Pincher has been suspended from the Conservative Party and will be investigated over allegations of sexual misconduct that he drunkenly groped two men. UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has assented Pincher's suspension till the time he is investigated. Earlier, Pincher resigned as Deputy Chief Whip of the Conservative Party over the incident.

10.title: Fact-checker Mohammed Zubair denied bail, sent to 14-day judicial custody
10.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was on Saturday sent to 14-day judicial custody by the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate of the Patiala House Court in Delhi. His plea for bail has been rejected by the court. The 33-year-old was arrested and booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments in a tweet in 2018.

11.title: Free power, water, healthcare in MP if AAP wins civic polls: Kejriwal
11.article_body: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday announced that his party would provide free water, electricity and healthcare if voted to power in Madhya Pradesh local body polls. "Congress and BJP have cheated you. Give us a chance...If we don't work, kick us out," he added. "I assure you Singrauli will be developed like Delhi," Kejriwal further said.

12.title: Travelled in locals, got pinched: Raveena to trolling on opposing metro
12.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon responded to a troll who said elites don't understand how Mumbaikers live, tweeting, "Teen yrs, travelled in locals/buses, got eveteased, pinched...that most women go through." Replying to another troll who tagged her in a video of a full local train, she wrote, "Uptil 1991, I travelled like this...also got physically harassed by nameless trolls like you."

13.title: Hyd Police asks Google to remove 221 loan apps over cheating complaints
13.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police have asked Google to remove 221 loan apps from its Play Store after receiving several complaints of harassment and cheating against such apps, Hyderabad Police tweeted on Saturday. Upon receiving the complaints, police said they launched an investigation against the apps and they were found to be illegal. Many were also found to be fake.

14.title: UP CM’s visit to Bhagya Laxmi Temple in Hyd postponed to Sunday: Report
14.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath's visit to the Bhagya Lakshmi Temple at Hyderabad's Charminar has been postponed till Sunday by the Telangana BJP over "important engagements". According to sources cited by The Siasat Daily, the IB has advised the UP CM against visiting the temple over the Nupur Sharma controversy. Yogi Adityanath was supposed to visit the temple on Saturday afternoon.

15.title: 3 arrested for selling bank accounts opened using fake documents in Mumbai
15.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested three cybercriminals who allegedly set up bank accounts using fake documents and sold these accounts to criminals for ₹10,000 each. Their module was busted during the investigation of a cybercrime case where a Mumbai resident lost ₹2 lakh, police said. Police seized 29 debit cards, seven mobile phones, 15 SIM cards and chequebooks from them.

16.title: Man kills brother over property dispute in Palghar, arrested
16.article_body: A 53-year-old man, Chindya Binder, was arrested for allegedly killing his younger brother, 51-year-old Ramesh Binder, over a property dispute in Maharashtra's Palghar, police said. The accused arrived at his brother's house, picked a quarrel with him and attacked him with a sharp weapon, killing him on the spot. Ramesh's body was sent to government hospital for post-mortem, police added.

17.title: 10-yr-old Licypriya shares pics of area around Taj Mahal before & after it was cleaned
17.article_body: Licypriya Kangujam, a 10-year-old climate activist, tweeted pictures of the area around Taj Mahal before and after it was cleaned. "Awesome to see the change and...initiative taken by you," a Twitter user commented. "Congratulations! You made a change," another comment read. "Behind the beauty of Taj Mahal is plastic pollution," she earlier wrote while sharing photo of the trash.

18.title: Is he Yuvi or Bumrah, reminded me of 2007: Sachin on Bumrah's world record
18.article_body: Reacting to Jasprit Bumrah slamming record 29 runs in an over by England pacer Stuart Broad in fifth Test, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Kya yeh Yuvi hai ya Bumrah!? 2007 ki yaad dilaa di. (Is he Yuvi or Bumrah...Reminded me of 2007)." Yuvraj Singh had slammed six sixes in an over bowled by Broad in a 2007 T20 World Cup match.

19.title: Video shows Stuart Broad bowling most expensive over in Test cricket history
19.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad on Saturday bowled the most expensive over in the history of Test cricket, against India in the rescheduled fifth Test. Broad conceded a total of 35 runs, out of which 29 were hit by India captain Jasprit Bumrah and the rest were extras. Broad's over read 4, 5(4+wide), 7(6+no-ball), 4, 4, 4, 6, 1.

20.title: Brother of former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains arrested in rape case
20.article_body: Ludhiana Police in Punjab has arrested Karamjit Singh Bains, brother of former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains, in an alleged rape case of a 44-year-old woman. Simarjeet, along with his two brothers and four others, have already been declared proclaimed offenders in the case. As per reports, Simarjeet continues to be at large.

21.title: Broad now holds world record for bowling most expensive over in Tests and T20Is
21.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad now holds the world record for bowling the most expensive over in both Test and T20I cricket. Broad conceded 35 runs in an over against India in fifth Test on Saturday to concede most runs in an over in Test history. He had conceded 36 runs in an over against India in 2007 T20 World Cup.

22.title: B'luru Urban Dy Commissioner transferred after ACB questions him
22.article_body: The Karnataka government on Friday transferred Bengaluru Urban Deputy Commissioner J Manjunath, a day after the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) interrogated him in a corruption case. In May 2021, two of Manjunath's staff were arrested while allegedly receiving a ₹5 lakh bribe to get a favourable order from a court. He's now been made Director of the Integrated Child Protection Scheme.

23.title: Studying technical interventions to decongest traffic in B'luru: BBMP official
23.article_body: The Bengaluru civic body is studying technical interventions like automatic signalling and traffic movement at junctions, etc to help reduce congestion in the city, BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath said. "Automatic signalling is one thing suggested by the CM so that traffic can be smoothened," Nath said. Bengaluru has one of the highest traffic to population densities in India.

24.title: Swiatek reminds me a bit of Djokovic: Cornet ahead of 3rd round at Wimbledon
24.article_body: Ahead of her third round match against Iga Swiatek at Wimbledon, unseeded Frenchwoman Alize Cornet said the way the top seed moves and glides on the court reminds her a bit of Novak Djokovic. "I don't know "her ball" yet, I'm yet to discover it but I think she's very strong," she added. Swiatek is on a 37-match winning streak.

25.title: 40-year-old man shot dead outside his office in Delhi
25.article_body: A 40-year-old man was shot dead by unknown persons who opened fire on the victim outside his office in Paschim Vihar, police said on Saturday. Police said an investigation into the matter is in progress, adding that nine teams, including special staff, are working on the case. Meanwhile, police have recovered empty bullet cartridges from the spot.

26.title: Income Tax portal facing issues, Infosys has observed some irregular traffic: Govt
26.article_body: The government on Saturday said it has noticed that taxpayers are facing issues in accessing the Income Tax e-filing portal. "As informed by Infosys, they have observed some irregular traffic on the portal for which proactive measures are being taken," the Income Tax Department wrote on Twitter. The tax e-filing portal built by Infosys was launched on June 7, 2021.

27.title: 18-yr-old UP Dalit boy dies in explosion under cot; probe underway
27.article_body: An 18-year-old Dalit boy was recently killed in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow allegedly after an explosion took place under his cot while he was sleeping. The deceased's father, in his complaint, has said that two upper caste men killed his son over "enmity with the family". "We have four suspects as per the probe," ASP Hirdesh Katheriya said.

28.title: 14 more killed amid floods in Assam; death toll rises to 173
28.article_body: The death toll due to floods and landslides in Assam has risen to 173, according to Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA). This comes after 14 more people, including six children, died after drowning in flood waters in the state in the last 24 hours. Nearly 29.70 lakh people in 30 districts of the state have been affected by floods.

29.title: He is India's best Test batter at the moment: Jaffer on Pant's 111-ball 146
29.article_body: After Rishabh Pant hit 111-ball 146 in rescheduled fifth India-England Test in Edgbaston, Wasim Jaffer said the India wicketkeeper-batter is definitely the best Test batter at the moment. Pant, who scored the hundred in 89 balls, broke MS Dhoni's record for the fastest Test century by an Indian wicketkeeper-batter. Dhoni had smashed a 93-ball hundred against Pakistan in 2006.

30.title: Crowd attacks, tears clothes of Udaipur killing accused outside court; video surfaces
30.article_body: A video has shown a crowd attacking the men accused in Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's killing when they were presented before an NIA court in Jaipur on Saturday. The crowd is seen tearing the clothes of the accused men before police personnel put them in a van outside the court. All four accused were sent to a 10-day NIA remand.

31.title: Israel, Poland criticise Ukrainian envoy for defending WW2 nationalist
31.article_body: Ukraine's ambassador to Germany has been criticised by Israeli and Polish governments for his statement saying Ukrainian nationalist leader Stepan Bandera was not a "mass murderer of Poles and Jews". "The statement...belittles the Holocaust," the Israeli embassy stated. Bandera headed the radical wing of a Ukrainian nationalist group which killed tens of thousands of Poles during World War 2.

32.title: Blasts in Mykolaiv a day after 21 killed near Odesa in Ukraine
32.article_body: Explosions rocked the Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv on Saturday, said the city's mayor. "Stay in shelters!" the mayor warned city residents. This comes a day after at least 21 people were reportedly killed in an alleged Russian missile strike near Odesa. On Friday, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy termed the recent bombardment of Ukrainian cities as "conscious, deliberately targeted Russian terror".

33.title: Karthik criticises ECB over 'Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline for highlights
33.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik criticised England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) for 'Joe Root dismisses dominant Pant' headline of their YouTube video for highlights of Day 1 of the rescheduled fifth Test. Karthik wrote, "After such an engrossing, enthralling day's play, I'm sure the headline can be much better and apt than this." Pant slammed 146 runs off 111 deliveries.

34.title: Activist Teesta Setalvad, ex-Gujarat DGP sent to judicial custody
34.article_body: Activist Teesta Setalvad and former Gujarat DGP RB Sreekumar were on Sunday sent to judicial custody by a court in Ahmedabad. Earlier on June 26, the duo was sent to the Ahmedabad crime branch's custody for questioning till July 2. Their judicial custody will continue until bail is granted. So far, no bail application has been moved.

35.title: My character in 'Shamshera' is both funny, dangerous: Sanjay Dutt
35.article_body: Sanjay Dutt, while talking about his character Shuddh Singh in 'Shamshera', said that it's both funny and dangerous. "Audience should love him!" Sanjay said. "It's a character...you have never seen on screen...I loved the fact that Karan Malhotra created a villain like this and...thought of me to play this role," Sanjay had said earlier. 'Shamshera' also stars Ranbir Kapoor.

36.title: Salah signs new long-term Liverpool contract to extend Anfield stay
36.article_body: Mohamed Salah has signed a new long-term contract to extend his stay at Liverpool, the club announced on Friday. The forward was named FWA Footballer of the Year and PFA Players' Player of the Year for 2021-22 after helping Jürgen Klopp's side to a domestic cup double. Salah has scored 156 goals in 254 club appearances since arriving in 2017.

37.title: BJP's national executive meeting commences in Hyd; PM Modi present
37.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) two-day national executive meeting commenced in Hyderabad on Saturday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP chief JP Nadda and other party leaders are present in the meeting. Earlier today, PM Modi took to Twitter and informed that a wide range of issues aimed at further strengthening the party will be discussed in the meeting.

38.title: Premarital sex, premarital pregnancy are matters of personal choice: Dia Mirza
38.article_body: Dia Mirza has said even though many are critical of premarital sex and premarital pregnancy, "there are enough people who recognise...it's a personal choice". "I feel when it comes to...personal choice, it can only be celebrated...by...those who ensure they make personal choices," she stated. "I don't think we're as progressive as we imagine...ourselves to be," Dia told Times of India.

39.title: CCTV video shows alleged killers of Amravati man who supported Nupur Sharma
39.article_body: CCTV footage has shown deceased chemist Umesh Kolhe being tailed by his alleged killers in Maharashtra's Amravati. Kolhe was stabbed to death on June 21 after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma. The footage was recorded between 10 pm and 10.30 pm when Kolhe was reportedly waylaid by the accused while he was returning home from his pharmacy.

40.title: Keep the flag high, proud of you: Harbhajan on Jadeja's ton in 5th Test
40.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to praise Ravindra Jadeja following the India all-rounder's century in the first innings of rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Jadeja, that's one of the best inn [innings]...what a 100...keep the flag high...Jadeja very proud of you," he wrote. Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Valuable hundred baapu. Batting at his peak of ability." Jadeja scored a 194-ball 104.

41.title: Audience didn't want to let go of my image after Mohabbatein: Preeti
41.article_body: Preeti Jhangiani, who made her Bollywood debut with Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Mohabbatein in 2000, said the audience had a certain image of her after the film which they didn't wanted to let go. "But...times have completely changed now, so I don't think that's an issue," she said, adding that she might return to acting if she gets an interesting role.

42.title: Father-son make video of married woman, blackmail her for money in Mysuru
42.article_body: Karnataka Police have booked father and son for allegedly blackmailing a married woman with her private video in Mysuru. The accused, who lived near the woman's house, allegedly recorded her video on phone while bathing and had been using it to blackmail her to extract money for the past two years. As per authorities, they also harassed her sexually.

43.title: Former Kerala MLA PC George arrested in sexual harassment case
43.article_body: Senior Kerala politician and former MLA PC George was on Saturday arrested on charges of sexually harassing a woman, who is also an accused in the solar panel case. George reportedly claimed that he was arrested as part of a conspiracy by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The woman has alleged that George had invited her to the guest house in Thycaud.

44.title: 35,870 Russian soldiers killed, 1,582 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
44.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed around 35,870 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. As per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, its forces have destroyed 1,582 Russian tanks and over 400 aircraft, including 186 helicopters. The ministry said that 3,737 armoured personnel carriers, 800 artillery systems and 246 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed.

45.title: Messaged Świątek a couple of times as her gameplay has been crazy: Nadal
45.article_body: Talking about world number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek who's on a 37-match unbeaten run, Rafael Nadal said, "I've messaged [Iga] a couple of times because what she's playing is crazy." "The way she's able to keep her focus and winning spirit for so long is unbelievable...I'm quite happy that a girl like her is so successful," added Nadal.

46.title: My films get made, what can I do: Akshay on Madhavan's 40 day remark
46.article_body: On being asked about R Madhavan's comment on actors giving only 40-45 days to shoot a film, actor Akshay Kumar said, "My films get made, what can I do? It's not in my control that my films wrap up so fast." The actor further said, "If a director...tells me my work is done, go home, should I fight with him?"

47.title: Husband is very supportive of my political career, it has shocked me: Urmila
47.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar said in an interview that her husband, Mohsin Akhtar, has been "so extremely supportive" of her political career that it has shocked her. "He has given me more strength to speak my mind out, the way I have been speaking," Urmila said, adding, "After being...a blessed daughter, I am a blessed wife and a daughter-in-law."

48.title: Root knows DNA of Test cricket; that's what makes him great: Chopra
48.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that English batter Joe Root knows the "DNA of Test cricket" and that makes him "great". "Root likes to cut the ball or use the backfoot punch or pull and knows how to build his innings," Chopra said. "There is a very small window of opportunity to get Root out," he added.

49.title: PM Modi has not actually understand MGNREGA: Rahul Gandhi
49.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was "shocked" when PM Narendra Modi spoke against the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) in Lok Sabha. "PM called [MGNREGA] a living monument of the failures of the UPA," Gandhi said. "It made me realise that the PM actually had not understood the depth of MGNREGA," he added.

50.title: Woman kills 3-yr-old daughter before dying by suicide in Bengaluru
50.article_body: A 31-year-old woman allegedly killed her 3-year-old daughter and later died by suicide at her apartment in Bengaluru's RR Nagar on Thursday. According to police, the deceased was depressed over her health issues. Her husband who works as a software engineer also lived with them in the apartment. An investigation is underway to ascertain whether the couple had marital problems.

51.title: Taron Egerton confirms meeting Marvel chief for Wolverine role
51.article_body: Actor Taron Egerton in an interview with The New York Times confirmed that he has been in talks with Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige and other executives about taking on the role of Wolverine, previously played by Hugh Jackman. "Hopefully if it does come around, they'll give me a shot," the 'Rocketman' actor added.

52.title: Nikki tests COVID positive for 2nd time, says couldn't breathe at one point
52.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 14' fame Nikki Tamboli has tested positive for COVID-19. The actress stated that she initially neglected the symptoms assuming it to be a change in weather. "However, when I was coming back to Mumbai in...flight, I just couldn't breathe at one point," Nikki added. Notably, this is the second time that Nikki has tested positive for the virus.

53.title: Got to win overseas Tests to become world number 1: Pat Cummins
53.article_body: After winning the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle, Australian skipper Pat Cummins said that one needs to win overseas Tests to be the world's "number one" team. "...Mitchell Starc working on the reverse swing, Nathan Lyon coming up with a few new balls. There is so much to learn and be successful on these (Lankan) wickets," Cummins said.

54.title: Elon Musk tweets tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who died from cancer at 23
54.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted a tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who passed away due to stage four cancer on July 1. "Cancer is an absurd piece of literal garbage and death," the image shared by Musk read. Technoblade, whose real name was revealed as Alex after his death, had more than 12 million subscribers on YouTube.

55.title: 'Zubair's bail plea order leaked by Delhi DCP', says his lawyer; officer clarifies
55.article_body: After reports claimed that the bail plea of fact-checker Mohammed Zubair was rejected by a Delhi court, Zubair's lawyer said the order was "leaked" to the media by Delhi DCP KPS Malhotra. Advocate Soutik Banerjee said the judge has reserved the matter for judgment and called Malhotra's actions "scandalous". Malhotra clarified that he "misheard" the order that was "inadvertently" broadcast.

56.title: Terrible feeling to be in opposing box against Novak: Ex-coach Vajda
56.article_body: Novak Djokovic's former coach Marian Vajda, who coached the tennis player for 15 years, said it was "very strange to be in the opposing box" against Djokovic during a French Open 2022 match. Tennis player Alex Molcan, who's being coached by Vajda, played against Djokovic in the second round. "It was a terrible feeling...Novak...also felt very bad," stated Vajda.

57.title: 91-yr-old billionaire Rupert Murdoch's 4th wife Jerry files for divorce after 6 yrs
57.article_body: Model Jerry Hall has filed for divorce from media tycoon Rupert Murdoch after six years of marriage. Hall has cited "irreconcilable differences" between her and Murdoch, and sought unspecified spousal support from the 91-year-old billionaire. This will be the fourth divorce for Murdoch. The 66-year-old model was previously the long-term partner of The Rolling Stones' lead vocalist Mick Jagger.

58.title: Do something honourable about your honour: Anupam on SC's statement on Nupur
58.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher reacted to the Supreme Court's statement on former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, tweeting, "Your Honour! Do something honourable about your HONOUR!" The Supreme Court had stated, "She has a threat or she has become a security threat?...This lady is single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country. We saw the debate."

59.title: HIV speeds up body’s ageing process soon after infection: Study
59.article_body: HIV has an early and substantial impact on the process of ageing, a study has found. Highlighting the need for early diagnosis of the infection, the study stated that HIV can start impacting ageing within just two to three years of contracting the virus. Moreover, HIV may rapidly cut about five years off an individual's life span, it stated.

60.title: Govt grants financial help to families of 35 deceased journalists
60.article_body: The central government has approved a proposal of the Journalist Welfare Scheme Committee to provide financial relief of ₹5 lakh to the families of 35 deceased journalists, including those who died due to COVID-19. The committee has also recommended assistance to two journalists suffering from permanent disability. The committee has approved a total assistance of ₹1.81 crore during a meeting.

61.title: Gambia bans all timber exports to combat rosewood smuggling
61.article_body: The Gambia on Friday banned timber exports and revoked all timber export licences to combat the illegal smuggling of endangered rosewood. The government has also instructed port authorities to oversee and prevent any loading of logs onto any vessels. The West African nation has exported an estimated 1.6 million rosewood trees since 2012, according to the Environmental Investigation Agency.

62.title: Shoes, jackets, ornaments barred for Himachal police re-exam after paper leak
62.article_body: Following the paper leak of the written test held in March to recruit Himachal Pradesh Police constables, examinees taking the re-examination on Sunday have been prohibited from wearing jackets and metal ornaments in the examination hall. The examinees also have been asked to wear slippers and flip-flops, instead of socks and shoes. They have been barred from carrying electronic devices.

63.title: Priyanka's brand criticised for being overpriced, people point out tablecloth worth ₹30,000
63.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, who recently launched her homeware brand SONA Home, has been called out for keeping the prices of the items 'exorbitantly high'. "I wanna be rich to a point where I can casually buy a SONA Home tablecloth worth ₹30,000," a tweet read. "Whitewashed millionaire Indian selling overpriced bulls**t to goras as 'exotic' Indian designs," another person commented.

64.title: Ranveer Singh made Alauddin Khilji in Padmaavat look 'terrifying': Ranbir
64.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent video shared by Yash Raj Films, praised actors who have essayed negative roles in films. "In Padmaavat, Ranveer...made Alauddin Khilji so terrifying, that even after...film ends, the character stays with you," Ranbir said. He also called Shah Rukh Khan's role in 'Darr' the "most iconic". "My dream is to play a negative role," Ranbir added.

65.title: I would've been fined 15,000 pounds: Kyrgios on Bublik's underarm serves
65.article_body: Discussing tennis player Alexander Bublik's six underarm serves in his third round match of Wimbledon 2022, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios tweeted, "If it was me, I [would've been]...fined a minimum of 15,000 pounds." Kyrgios added he would have also been "accused of tanking". Kyrgios was recently seen spitting in the direction of an abusive spectator during a Wimbledon match.

66.title: Single-use plastic ban good, but alternatives are costly: Traders
66.article_body: As single-use plastic  (SUP) items have been banned in India, Delhi traders selling these items said alternatives to SUPs are few and costly. Delhi-based Rajeev Sahni, who runs a shop selling disposables, said, "The ban...is good. But we need easily available [and] pocket-friendly alternatives." "Customers are running away now since prices of (alternatives to SUPs) have risen," a wholesaler said.

67.title: Delhi Police constable kills self with service pistol; body found in car
67.article_body: A Delhi Police constable allegedly shot himself dead with his service revolver in Prashant Vihar, Delhi. The deceased, Amandeep Singh, was posted at the Prashant Vihar Police Station and was on casual leaves. The deceased's body was found lying inside a car parked near a petrol pump, police said. Notably, the body has been sent for post-mortem, police added.

68.title: Jasprit Bumrah breaks world record for scoring most runs in an over in a Test match
68.article_body: India captain Jasprit Bumrah on Saturday broke the world record for scoring the most runs in an over in a Test. The 28-year-old scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over in first innings of rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston. Bumrah slammed four fours and two sixes, and took a single. Broad conceded 35 runs in the over, including six extras.

69.title: Dad told me my films are good but they won't make me a national star: Ranbir
69.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed that his father, Rishi Kapoor, would tell him that the kind of films he does are good but they won't make him a "national star". "Now I understand...what he was trying to say," he added. Ranbir further said he always looks at his favourite heroes "from a low angle", adding, "I never see them as...equal to me."

70.title: PM Modi govt spends 6 times more on railways in Gujarat than UPA: Shah
70.article_body: Addressing a gathering in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that PM Narendra Modi-led Central government spends six times more money annually on railways in Gujarat than the previous UPA government. "UPA used to spend ₹590 crore every year on the railways in Gujarat. PM Modi increased this spending to ₹3,960 crore between 2014 and 2022," Shah added.

71.title: Modi govt is successfully killing democracy everyday: Telangana CM
71.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has accused the BJP-led Centre of "killing" democracy. "What the Modi administration is doing is successfully killing democracy everyday, throttling the federal system...toppling governments which do not toe their line," CM Rao said. "PM Modi is the 15th PM...and in terms of the last 14 PMs, never has India's image been affected," he added.

72.title: Bulgaria destroys Soviet-era naval mine off its Black Sea coast
72.article_body: Bulgaria's Defence Ministry said its military has carried out a controlled explosion of a Soviet-era naval mine that had drifted close to the country's Black Sea coast. The mine was first spotted by a motor ship, it added. Black Sea countries began to report the appearance of such mines floating in the sea after Russia began invading Ukraine in February.

73.title: India score 35 runs as Stuart Broad bowls most expensive over in Test cricket history
73.article_body: England pacer Stuart Broad on Saturday bowled the most expensive over in Test history after India aggregated 35 runs from his 18th over in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test. India captain Jasprit Bumrah scored 29 runs off the over, while the remaining runs came off extras.  The previous most expensive over in Test history went for 28 runs.

74.title: BJP denies link to Udaipur killing accused as pics of him with local leaders emerge
74.article_body: After several pictures showing Udaipur killing accused Riyaz Akhtari with members of the Rajasthan BJP surfaced online, the party denied having any links with him. "Anyone can have a photo with any leader. It doesn't mean that he's a member," said Rajasthan's BJP Minority Morcha chief Mohammad Sadiq Khan. An India Today report said Akhtari had attended BJP events.

75.title: Heavy jewellery in 'Chamma Chamma' could have got me hospitalised: Urmila
75.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar, while talking about her song 'Chamma Chamma', recalled how director Rajkumar Santoshi told her to reduce the jewellery she was wearing as they were too heavy for dancing. The actress said that she refused and was later hit by the ornaments during the shoot. "By...end of those four days, I could've been hospitalised from all...scratches," she added.

76.title: Haven't seen him on set: Mandar on reports of Raj Anadkat quitting 'Taarak...'
76.article_body: Actor Mandar Chandwadkar, who plays Bhide on 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has reacted to reports claiming actor Raj Anadkat has quit the show. "As artists, we don't know if he has quit...but he'd some health issues due to which he hasn't been shooting for...past few days. I haven't seen him on...set," he said. Raj plays Tapu on the show.

77.title: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia opens 1.2 km km-long Benito Juarez Marg underpass
77.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday inaugurated the 1.2 km-long Y-shaped Benito Juarez Marg underpass. The underpass starts at the Delhi Metro's Durgabai Deshmukh South Campus station and connects the South Campus to AIIMS and Moti Bagh. "Adding to the economic value of saving time, this underpass will save ₹18 crore for Delhiites every year," Sisodia tweeted.

78.title: Govt warns edtech firms against unfair trade practices, misleading ads
78.article_body: The Central government has warned edtech companies against unfair trade practices and said that if self-regulation doesn't curb such practices, stringent guidelines will be formulated. Consumer Affairs Secretary Rohit Kumar Singh flagged concerns over misleading ads and increasing fake reviews. Notably, the education category was the largest violator of advertising code in 2021-22, as per ASCI.

79.title: Viruses make people more attractive to mosquitoes: Study
79.article_body: Mosquitoes choose their target on basis of people's body temperature, odour and CO2 from their breath. Some viruses alter body odour in a way that makes people more attractive to mosquitoes, a study stated. They can also transfer the virus from an infected person to another person through bites. Researchers also found that mosquitoes are more attracted to acetophenone's odour.

80.title: Delhi court rejects Zubair's bail plea, sends him to 14-day judicial custody
80.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair's bail plea and sent him to a 14-day judicial custody in a case related to an "objectionable" tweet he had posted in 2018. Delhi Police produced Zubair before the Chief Metropolitan Magistrate and sought a 14-day custody after seizing his mobile phone and recovering a hard disk during investigation.

81.title: Anand Mahindra shares pics from Pant's knock against England, says 'Test cricket tandav'
81.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a collage of pictures from Rishabh Pant's 146-run knock against England in the rescheduled fifth Test. "Test cricket tandav. Rishabh Pant is a sports artiste. Impossible not to marvel at him," Mahindra wrote alongside the collage. Rishabh recorded the fastest Test hundred by a Team India wicketkeeper off 89 deliveries.

82.title: Mithali shares letter PM Modi wrote on her retirement, says 'I'll treasure this forever'
82.article_body: Former India Women captain Mithali Raj took to Twitter to share a letter PM Modi wrote to her while congratulating her on her retirement. "It’s a matter of singular honour & pride when one receives such warm encouragement from our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi ji," she wrote. She added, "I will treasure this forever."

83.title: Smashed glass on face to get audience's attention: Machine Gun Kelly
83.article_body: Speaking about smashing a champagne glass on his face mid-concert in New York, singer Machine Gun Kelly said he did it to get the audience's attention. "You know when you clink a champagne glass with a fork to kind of [get people's attention]? Yeah, well, I didn't have a fork. So I just clinked it on my head," he said.

84.title: Sania Mirza and Mate Pavic enter 2nd round of Wimbledon mixed doubles
84.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza, who is making her final Wimbledon appearance, and Mate Pavic have entered mixed doubles second round after a win over David Vega Hernandez and Natela Dzalamidze on Friday. The sixth seeds defeated the unseeded pair 6-4, 3-6, 7-6(10-3) on Friday. Sania has already announced her retirement at the end of this season.

85.title: 3 bike-borne men killed after being hit by vehicle in UP's Firozabad
85.article_body: Three men travelling on a motorcycle were killed after being hit by a vehicle in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad district on Friday. The deceased, identified as Jaicharan (25), Ganesh (23) and Narendra (24), were travelling to Delhi from Banda before being hit by the unidentified vehicle. Two of them were from Banda while the remaining one was from Sultanpur, police said.

86.title: Naming colonies after PM, Chief Minister in Bihar unethical: RJD leader
86.article_body: RJD leader Shivanand Tiwary on Friday criticised the proposal to name residential colonies for the homeless in Bihar after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. "To name a scheme that uses public funds after a living person...would be unethical," he said. "It should be named after any luminary from our state with an underprivileged background," Tiwary suggested.

87.title: B'luru police clear road after complaint on 'autos parked haphazardly'
87.article_body: Bengaluru's HAL Airport Traffic police tweeted on Friday that they have cleared the road and put a 'no parking' sign after a Twitter user complained about many autos parked "haphazardly" on the Suranjan Das road. The Twitter user had tagged Bengaluru City Traffic police and said, "[Is] this a designated auto stand?... Why are you not taking this seriously?"

88.title: Thousands rally in Australia against overturning of US abortion law
88.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets of Australia on Saturday to rally against the US Supreme Court's decision to overturn a ruling that legalised abortion. Protesters were seen holding placards that read "Hands off my uterus" and "I'll not quietly go back to the 1950s". "Abortion is healthcare and every woman deserves a right to that," a protester said.

89.title: Ravindra Jadeja smashes his first international hundred outside India
89.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja on Saturday completed his first-ever overseas hundred in international cricket. The 33-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 183 deliveries in India's first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston. Overall, it is Jadeja's third hundred in Test cricket. Jadeja's first two hundreds had come in Rajkot and Mohali.

90.title: Judge asked dad if he's okay if I don't get married after adoption: Sushmita
90.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen has revealed that during the adoption hearing for her first daughter Renee, the judge asked her father if he is okay with her decision because it would affect her marriage plans. The actress said that her father stated he had never raised Sushmita to only be someone's wife. Sushmita added that she was sobbing during the hearing.

91.title: PMC extends deadline for regularisation of illegal homes
91.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has extended the deadline for regularisation of illegal homes made on small plots under the Gunthewari scheme till March 31, 2023. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar urged citizens to take benefit of the scheme, under which unauthorised small plots can reportedly have legal construction for 20 years. Notably, the deadline has been extended for the fourth time.

92.title: Musk breaks his 9-day silence on Twitter, shares pic of him and his kids with Pope
92.article_body: Elon Musk broke his nine-day silence on Twitter, the social media platform he is trying to buy for $44 billion, by posting a picture of him meeting Pope Francis. The world's richest person tweeted, "Honored to meet the Pope yesterday." Musk's four teenage boys can also be seen in the picture.

93.title: It felt like a new journey started: Aditya on transition from TV to films
93.article_body: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur, who worked as a VJ (video jockey) on a music channel before entering Bollywood, called his transition from TV to films "seamless". "When I did get into film, it just felt like a new journey started," he added. The actor, who also hosted a TV show, called the television audience "very different" from that of films.

94.title: Every day at least 1 or 2 Afghan women die by suicide: Ex-Dy Speaker
94.article_body: Former Deputy Speaker of the Afghan Parliament Fawzia Koofi told Human Rights Council that every day at least one or two women die by suicide "due to...lack of opportunity and mental health pressures" in Afghanistan. "Girls as young as nine...are being sold, not only because of economic pressure but because...there's no hope for them, for their family," she added.

95.title: Southwest Monsoon covers entire country six days before normal date
95.article_body: The Southwest Monsoon has already covered the whole of India as of Saturday, said the latest India Meteorological Department (IMD) bulletin. The monsoon has advanced into the remaining parts of the North Arabian Sea, Gujarat and Rajasthan on July 2, six days earlier than the expected date. This comes as widespread rains continued in several parts of India.

96.title: Brave ball by Root to dismiss Pant who batted out of his skin: Collingwood
96.article_body: England assistant coach Paul Collingwood said Rishabh Pant batted out of his skin during his 146 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England. "It was a brave ball from Joe Root [to dismiss Pant]...but sometimes you need a bit of genius," he added. "When you watch someone as exciting as Pant, you've got to applaud," stated Collingwood.

97.title: Delhi likely to receive rainfall throughout the upcoming week: IMD
97.article_body: IMD has predicted that Delhi is expected to receive rains during the upcoming week (July 2-8). According to IMD, light rainfall is likely in the city on Saturday, Sunday and Monday, while heavy showers are expected on Wednesday. The maximum temperature is likely to range from 32-36°C, while the minimum temperature could range between 24-27°C over the next six days.

98.title: Govt orders NIA probe in killing of Amravati man who supported Nupur Sharma
98.article_body: The government has handed over the investigation into the June 21 killing of Maharashtra man Umesh Kolhe to the NIA. Amravati's Kolhe was stabbed to death after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, police said. "The conspiracy behind the killing, involvement of organisations, international linkages would be thoroughly investigated," said Home Minister's Office.

99.title: I was starstruck when I met Amitabh Bachchan: Madhuri Dixit
99.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has revealed that the first time she ever got starstruck on set was when she met veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan. The actress added that she got a little tongue-tied when she met him. Madhuri made a special appearance in the song 'Makhna' in 1998 film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' which also stars Govinda and Raveena Tandon.

100.title: Delhi man fakes robbery to use wife's money to clear debts; booked
100.article_body: Delhi Police have booked a man who allegedly made a fake robbery story of ₹2 lakh in a bid to use his wife's money to pay off his debts. Police investigation revealed the accused had incurred heavy losses during the COVID-19 pandemic and was in debt. Meanwhile, police have recovered the amount, which he had kept hidden in his car.

101.title: He was a new director: Mukesh on paying ₹7 lakh to Basu for 'Saaya' & 'Murder'
101.article_body: Producer Mukesh Bhatt has reacted to filmmaker Anurag Basu's old statement wherein he stated that he was paid just ₹7 lakh to direct both 'Saaya' and 'Murder'. Mukesh said, "He was a new director." He added, "Moreover, John Abraham was also a newcomer...So, for a film (Saaya) comprising a newcomer and a new director, what recovery can you expect?"

102.title: 6 students from Pune win national competition on rural innovation
102.article_body: A team of six students from Pune's Sanskriti School has won a national competition on rural innovation. As part of 'Future Entrepreneurs 2021', the students have designed a farmer-friendly product based on the theme of rural ecosystem. "The product we have innovated can help to clean cattle in 10-15 minutes with longer brushes which are automated," one of them said.

103.title: ₹1.65 crore modular operation theatre inaugurated at Pune hospital
103.article_body: A state-of-the-art modular operation theatre built for ₹1.65 crore was inaugurated at Pune's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Cantonment General Hospital on Friday. The operation theatre was funded under corporate social responsibility. The Pune Cantonment Board's CEO Subrat Pal thanked people for their financial assistance and said that the hospital will continue to provide good service in the future.

104.title: China's Great Wall Motors drops $1 bn India entry plan, reportedly fires staff
104.article_body: Chinese carmaker Great Wall Motors has abandoned its $1-billion plan to enter the Indian market. The development comes after the company failed to get the government's approval to acquire General Motors' Talegaon plant near Pune after waiting for two and a half years. The company has shut its India office and terminated its team of 8-10 employees, as per reports.

105.title: Man stabbed to death after sharing WhatsApp post supporting Nupur Sharma in Maha
105.article_body: A man named Umesh Kolhe was stabbed to death in Maharashtra's Amravati on June 21 after he shared a post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma on some WhatsApp groups, police said. At least five people have been arrested for the 54-year-old's murder. The incident took place a week before Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal was beheaded for supporting Sharma.

106.title: Scared to go on pothole-filled, chaotic Mumbai roads: Hema Malini
106.article_body: Actress-turned-politician Hema Malini spoke about the roads of Mumbai, saying that she is scared to go on them due to the traffic and chaos. "I just can't imagine how a pregnant woman must be travelling on these roads that are full of potholes," she added. Hema further said that places like Delhi and Mathura have traffic but it is streamlined.

107.title: Don't know how he's out of form for so long: Manjrekar on Kohli's dismissal
107.article_body: Sanjay Manjrekar said he "doesn't know" how Virat Kohli's been out of form for "so long" having been dismissed for 11 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England. "When great batters go out of form, they come back in form quickly," added Manjrekar. "The confidence has gone down...he's enduring...bad luck, also there are technical issues," he stated.

108.title: Delhi woman slips from stairs, dies as mangalsutra slits her throat
108.article_body: A 22-year-old woman died after allegedly falling from the stairs in her house in Delhi. Police said, prima facie, the injuries suggest that her mangalsutra got entangled around her neck and slit her throat. "Her four-year-old son was with her...He told the police that his mother had gone to the terrace to put clothes to dry," an officer said.

109.title: Another landslide hits Manipur as death toll from previous one rises to 24
109.article_body: The death toll due to the landslide at Tupul in Manipur's Noney has risen to 24, officials said. Notably, another landslide hit the state on Saturday at a construction site in Noney. The first landslide occurred on Wednesday where a company of the 107 Territorial Army (TA) was deployed at a construction site near the Tupul yard railway construction site.

110.title: Want to uplift people through infra development: Droupadi Murmu
110.article_body: While addressing a function in Himachal Pradesh's Baddi on Friday, NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu said she wants to uplift people through infrastructure development at the grassroots level. She also praised Himachal for "showing the way to the country in various parameters of development". Supporting Murmu, CM Jai Ram Thakur said that her victory in the Presidential poll is certain.

111.title: 52-yr-old woman trampled to death by an elephant in Chhattisgarh
111.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was trampled to death by an elephant in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur on Thursday night, a forest official said. "An elephant entered the house of Gurbari Bai and killed her while she was asleep. The tusker reportedly reached the village from the Jharkhand border," the official said. Financial aid of ₹25,000 was given to the family members, he added.

112.title: Pune to receive light showers for next few days: IMD
112.article_body: After light rainfall was reported in Pune on Friday, the India Meteorological Department has said that the light showers are going to continue for the next few days in the district. "There are packed isobars due to the presence of offshore trough and strong westerlies...[Therefore,] rainfall is likely to continue," an official said. Notably, Lavale recorded 7 mm rainfall yesterday.

113.title: Cost of electric vehicles should be affordable for common man: Bommai
113.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday appealed to the automobile manufacturers to focus on making electric vehicles which are affordable for the common man. "Then only its usage could see an increase," Bommai said. After inaugurating 152 EV charging stations in Bengaluru, he said, "The state government has decided to induct more EV buses into Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC)."

114.title: Will she dump Yashwant?: Malviya after Mamata's remarks on Murmu
114.article_body: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she could've considered NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu as a consensus candidate, BJP leader Amit Malviya said, "Will she dump [Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha]?" He also claimed that Mamata has realised that her anti-tribal and anti-woman position is "untenable". "Murmu is more likely to win...polls," Mamata had said.

115.title: Only 30% in 12-15 yrs group received 2nd COVID dose in Pune: Health dept
115.article_body: Around 29.62% of beneficiaries in the 12-15 years age group have received their second COVID dose in Pune. According to the state health department, around 55.21% of the beneficiaries have received their first COVID dose. However, Pune's numbers are lagging behind the state's average figures which are at 60.1% for the first dose and 31.01% for second dose beneficiaries.

116.title: I have no idea why Jayeshbhai Jordaar didn't work: Boman Irani
116.article_body: Boman Irani, speaking about the underwhelming performance of 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' at the box office, said, "I've no idea why [it] didn't work...and I don't want to analyse it too." He added that the intention of the film was very good. Boman further said 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' was a great experience, and he loved what director Divyang Thakkar was trying to say.

117.title: 4 houses collapse in Mumbai's Chunabhatti, no casualties reported
117.article_body: Amid heavy rains, four houses collapsed in Mumbai's Chunabhatti area on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday. No casualties or injuries were reported from the incident. This comes after a portion of a 100-year-old building in Mumbai's Kalbadevi collapsed on Thursday. Another such incident was reported in Sion where a portion of ground-plus-five structures fell.

118.title: US truck driver who thought he won ₹1.5 lakh lottery, hits ₹7.5 cr jackpot
118.article_body: A truck driver in the US hit a jackpot of $1 million (₹7.5 crore) on a lottery ticket he initially thought had $2,000 (₹1.5 lakh) prize. "I didn't believe it was real until I called the lottery office to confirm my prize," the driver said. The driver plans to buy a new vehicle with the money and save the rest.

119.title: Karate champ Amritpal dedicates gold medal to Sonu Sood for helping with her surgery
119.article_body: Karate champion Amritpal Kaur dedicated her All India Karate Championship gold medal to Sonu Sood, who had helped with her knee surgery two years ago. "Sonu sir came to my aid when I was at my lowest," she wrote. The actor also shared pictures, writing, "When you see...positive impact you've had in other's lives...it makes your life even more worthwhile."

120.title: Edibles containing drug responsible for effects of marijuana legalised in Minnesota
120.article_body: A new Minnesota law allowing people 21 and older to buy edibles and beverages containing THC, the substance responsible for effects of marijuana on a person's mental state, has come into effect. Edibles and beverages can contain up to 5 milligrams of THC per serving and 50 milligrams per package. "This stuff will get you high," a lawyer said.

121.title: Rakul plays golf with Kapil Dev & Sadhguru in Washington DC, shares video
121.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh took to Instagram to share a video of her playing golf with Kapil Dev and Sadhguru. "What better than kickstarting ATA convention at Washington DC with @sadhguru @therealkapildev," she wrote. Reacting to Rakul's post, a fan wrote, "Amazing." Rakul, who was recently seen in 'Runway 34', will next be seen alongside Ayushmann Khurrana in 'Doctor G'.

122.title: Dinesh Karthik captains India in T20 practice match against Derbyshire, fans react
122.article_body: Dinesh Karthik, who is the senior-most member of India's current T20I squad, captained the team against Derbyshire in a T20 practice match on Friday. "Honestly speaking, I never imagined I will see Karthik leading Team India...in my lifetime. Though it's a mere practice match," a fan tweeted. "So so happy to see you in the captaincy role," wrote another.

123.title: He looked composed; unlucky to get out like that: Swann on Kohli
123.article_body: Former English spinner Graeme Swann said that the way Indian batter Virat Kohli was dismissed on Day 1 of the fifth Test was "quite unlucky" for the former Indian skipper. "Kohli looked really composed out there...if you see his legs, he was trying to get outside the off-stump...He looked devastated when he got out...as he wanted it today," Swann said.

124.title: I don't play in same manner so that bowler gets mentally disturbed: Pant
124.article_body: Following his 146 in India's first innings of the fifth Test against England, Rishabh Pant said, "I keep trying that I don't play in the same manner so that the bowler gets mentally disturbed." "Especially in conditions like England where...the bowler is bowling well...it becomes important to disturb his...line and length," added Pant. Pant had a strike rate of 131.53.

125.title: Don't forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani: KTR to BJP ahead of Hyd meet
125.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday took to Twitter to mock BJP ahead of its national executive meet in Hyderabad, saying, "To all the Jhumla Jeevis; Don’t forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani and Irani Chai." He also called the BJP a "WhatsApp University". "Please visit, take notes and try to implement in your states," he added.

126.title: California to end arrests for loitering for prostitution
126.article_body: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed a new state law that will stop police from arresting people for loitering for prostitution. "To be clear, this bill doesn't legalise prostitution," Newsom said. "It simply revokes provisions of the law that have led to disproportionate harassment of women" and transgender adults, he added, noting that Black and Latino women are particularly affected.

127.title: Footpath cracks open following landslide in Mumbai's Peddar Road area
127.article_body: Continuous rainfall in South Mumbai triggered a landslide on Thursday midnight near an under-construction building in the Tony Peddar Road area of Mumbai. The landslide resulted in the footpath along the stretch to crack wide open. According to BMC officials, no casualties were reported as there was no one on the footpath at the time of the incident.

128.title: NIA court convicts 5 members of banned outfit SIMI in Bijnor blast case
128.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has convicted five members of the banned outfit SIMI in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor blast case. The convicts have been sentenced to rigorous imprisonment from three years to a maximum of seven years and 10 months for various offences. The case relates to an explosion that took place in a house in Bijnor in 2014.

129.title: Harassed by moneylenders, family of 3 jump in canal & die in Punjab
129.article_body: A couple and their 10-year-old son allegedly jumped into the Kotla branch canal and died over harassment by moneylenders and due to their poor financial conditions in Punjab's Mansa. Two of the bodies have been recovered from the canal so far, an investigating officer said. The police also found a purported suicide note written on the son's notebook.

130.title: Had no plan to play at Wimbledon; saw grass, got excited: Venus
130.article_body: Former Grand Slam champion Venus Williams made a comeback at Wimbledon after being away from the court for almost a year. The 42-year-old American and her British partner Jamie Murray secured a win in their first round of the mixed-doubles event on Friday. "I had no plan to play (at Wimbledon). I saw the grass and got excited," Venus said.

131.title: 2 minor boys engaged in child labour rescued in Hyderabad
131.article_body: The SHE Teams of Rachakonda Police along with Operation Muskan Team on Friday rescued two minor boys engaged in child labour in Hyderabad. The boys belong to Bihar and were working at a service centre at Bandlaguda, under the limits of LB Nagar police station, Rachakonda Police said. The police also counselled their guardian about the Child Labour Act.

132.title: Jadeja's 83* was equally important as Pant's 146: Giles on Day 1
132.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said Ravindra Jadeja's 83* on Day 1 of the fifth Test against England was almost as important as Rishabh Pant's 146. "Someone had to be [the] anchor to allow Pant to play that way," added Giles. Jadeja and Pant stitched a record sixth-wicket partnership of 222 runs, helping India rebuild after being reduced to 98/5.

133.title: It's my duty to appear if ED summons me, can come again: Sanjay Raut
133.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said as a responsible citizen and Member of Parliament, it's his duty to appear if an investigative agency summons him. "Problem is with timing amid Maharashtra political crisis but they had doubts. Told them...I can come again if need be," Raut added. ED questioned Raut for 10 hours on Friday in a money laundering case.

134.title: Refused food on credit, man throws acid at sweet shop; 7 injured
134.article_body: Seven people were injured after a man allegedly threw acid at a sweetmeat stall in Haripur village of Jharkhand. According to police, after the shop owner refused to give him food on credit, the accused went home, returned with acid and threw it inside the shop. The injured people were taken to a local hospital.

135.title: India's largest floating solar power project fully operational in T'gana, pics released
135.article_body: India's largest floating solar power project is now fully operational, the government announced. The NTPC declared commercial operation of the final part capacity of 20 MW out of 100 MW Ramagundam Floating Solar PV Project at Ramagundam, Telangana with effect from July 1. The project spreads over 500 acres and is divided into 40 blocks.

136.title: Giant snail that can cause meningitis spotted in US county; quarantine ordered
136.article_body: A giant African land snail has been spotted in a Florida county, sending the area into quarantine. Giant African land snails can carry a parasite called rat lungworm, known to cause meningitis in humans and livestock, according to US Department of Agriculture. The snails can reach almost 8 inches long and 5 inches in diameter, the organisation said.

137.title: Entire budget of 'Shabaash Mithu' is equivalent to an A-lister's salary: Taapsee Pannu
137.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, in a recent interview, said that 'Shabaash Mithu' is her biggest budget film. She, however, added that the entire budget of the film is still equivalent to an A-lister's salary. "The situation is still like that. So, there is still a long way for us to go," she further stated, referring to pay disparity in Bollywood.

138.title: I was also offered to join rebel MLAs in Guwahati: Sena's Sanjay Raut
138.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that he was also offered to join the rebel MLAs in Guwahati. "I also got an offer for Guwahati but I follow Balasaheb Thackeray...so I didn't go there," he added. "When the truth is on your side, why fear?" Raut stated. Eknath Shinde, who was leading the rebel MLAs, became the new Maharashtra CM.

139.title: There is problem now: Chopra on Pujara being dismissed for 13(46)
139.article_body: After India batter Cheteshwar Pujara got dismissed for 13(46) in the fifth Test against England, former India cricketer Aakash Chopra said that "there is a problem now". "Pujara was going slowly-slowly, standing at one end...But the knock didn't last long. He again fell victim to James Anderson," Chopra said. He added, "Pujara is not getting his preferred No. 3 spot."

140.title: Can't get better than this: Ganguly on Pant-Jadeja's record stand
140.article_body: Reacting to the record sixth-wicket partnership of 222 runs between Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja in India's first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England, Sourav Ganguly tweeted, "Can't get better than this." "Special exhibition of Test match batting under pressure," he added. Sachin Tendulkar tweeted that Pant's 146 was "simply awesome", adding Jadeja played "amazing shots".

141.title: I hope both 'Raksha...' & 'Laal Singh...' do well at box office: Akshay
141.article_body: Akshay Kumar has opened up about the box office clash between his upcoming movie 'Raksha Bandhan' and Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "My film Welcome and his film Taare Zameen Par were released simultaneously. Both had done well. We are hoping that both...do well at the box office," he said. Both the films are scheduled to release on August 11.

142.title: Alt News' Zubair destroyed evidence, received donations from foreign nations: Police
142.article_body: The Delhi Police has added charges of criminal conspiracy and destruction of evidence in the case against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. The police also said that the accused received donations from foreign countries. "It was noticed that Twitter handles supporting Zubair after his arrest, were from Pakistan and mostly middle eastern countries," the police added.

143.title: Ukrainian borscht soup added to UNESCO endangered heritage list
143.article_body: UNESCO has added the cooking of Ukrainian borscht, a soup made of beetroot and other vegetables, to its list of endangered cultural traditions. The war in Ukraine has "threatened" the cooking of borscht, UNESCO said. Moscow decried the new protected Ukrainian status of the dish, which is also popular in Russia, saying the Russian version of borscht "doesn't need protection".

144.title: Was smoking a pipe, Dev Anand was impressed: Zeenat on bagging 'Hare...'
144.article_body: Zeenat Aman opened up about how she bagged the role of Janice in Dev Anand's 'Hare Rama Hare Krishna'. "I think he (Dev) was just impressed with the attitude and the persona I'd at that time," she said, adding, "I was smoking a pipe, wearing a skirt and he thought to himself that I would be perfect for the role."

145.title: 94% of new COVID-19 cases in Karnataka recorded in Bengaluru
145.article_body: Bengaluru on Friday reported 1,008 new coronavirus cases, which is nearly 94% of the total new cases recorded in Karnataka, according to official data. The city also recorded one death due to the virus the same day. The number of active clusters in Bengaluru fell to 13, however, the positivity rate rose to 4.24% as compared to a day earlier.

146.title: 1 injured as bike-borne man fires at pillion rider of another bike in Delhi
146.article_body: A firing incident was reported at 1:23 am on Saturday under Bindapur Police Station limits in Delhi, Dwarka district DCP said. "It's alleged...one of the two persons on a motorcycle fired on the pillion rider of another motorcycle, who is under treatment," the DCP added. "An attempt to murder case has been filed," the DCP further said.

147.title: Delhi Transport Dept gives nod to hike auto, taxi fares by ₹1.50 and ₹15
147.article_body: Delhi Transport Department gave its nod to hike fare prices of auto-rickshaws and taxis by ₹1.50 and ₹15 respectively per kilometre, officials said. The proposal will be tabled in the next cabinet meeting for a final nod, officials added. For AC taxis, meter charges will increase from ₹25 to ₹40 and for non-AC taxis from ₹14 to ₹17 per kilometre.

148.title: Centre promotes more than 8,000 govt employees in one go
148.article_body: The Centre ordered promotion of 8,089 employees belonging to Central Secretariat Service (CSS), Central Secretariat Stenographers' Service (CSSS) and Central Secretariat Clerical Service (CSCS) in one go. Of the 8,089, 4,734 are from CSS, 2,966 from CSSS and 389 from CSCS. "It was disheartening to see...employees [retiring]...without getting...due promotion," Minister Jitendra Singh tweeted.

149.title: Indian forces find 3-yr-old Pakistani boy at border, reunite him with family
149.article_body: A three-year-old Pakistani boy, who inadvertently reached the International Border in Punjab, has been handed over to his family by the Border Security Force. The incident was reported in Ferozepur sector of the state at around 7 pm on Friday when BSF troops noticed the child crying near the International Border fence.

150.title: Buses run on fuel generated from waste on pilot basis in Pune
150.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited on Friday plied buses running on compressed biogas (CBG) generated from wet waste from the city on a pilot basis. "It's a win-win situation as fuel is generated from waste and will help address Pune's garbage situation," Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said. In first trial, 10-15 buses will be run on CBG, PMC added.

151.title: Have utmost respect for religious beliefs: Samsung Pak after being accused of blasphemy
151.article_body: Samsung's Pakistan unit issued a statement as violent protests erupted in a Karachi mall after the multinational company was accused of blasphemy by a mob. Samsung said it "has utmost respect for all religious sentiments", adding that it has initiated a probe into the matter. Reportedly, over 20 Samsung employees were detained over this.

152.title: Criminal conspiracy, evidence destruction charges added against Alt News Co-founder
152.article_body: Delhi Police has added criminal conspiracy and the destruction of evidence charges in the case against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. "The accused received donations from foreign countries," it added. In the FIR, Section 35 in The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 2010, has now been added. Zubair was arrested in a case related to an alleged objectionable tweet in 2018.

153.title: 15 kg tumour removed from woman’s abdomen at Patna hospital
153.article_body: An ovarian tumour, weighing about 15 kg, was surgically removed from the abdomen of a 40-year-old woman at a government hospital in Patna. The patient was admitted to Nalanda Medical College and Hospital with abdominal pain and swelling complaints. "The tumour was...largest ever to have been surgically extracted in our department," the doctor who headed the surgery said.

154.title: Punjab man stabs 11-yr-old boy to death over minor argument; held
154.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed an 11-year-old boy to death following a minor argument in Punjab's Ludhiana. The boy was selling boiled eggs on a cart near his house when the incident occurred, according to police. The deceased's mother claimed that onlookers had caught the accused, who was holding a "blood-soaked knife in his hand".

155.title: Colombia extradites sister of accused drug cartel leader to US
155.article_body: Colombia has extradited the sister of accused drug cartel leader Dairo Usaga to the US to face drug trafficking charges, police said. Colombian police accuse Nini Usaga of money laundering for the Clan del Golfo cartel and coordinating drug shipments abroad. Her brother, accused head of Clan del Golfo, was extradited to face drug trafficking charges in US in May.

156.title: 5 killed, 12 injured as earthquake of 6.0 magnitude hits Iran
156.article_body: At least five people have been killed and 12 others have been injured after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake hit southern Iran on Saturday, state television reported. Rescue teams have been deployed near the epicentre Sayeh Khosh village, home to around 300 people. Iran's deadliest quake was a 7.4-magnitude tremor that struck in 1990, killing 40,000 people in the country's north.

157.title: Fabulous given India were 98/5: Bishop on Pant-Jadeja's record stand
157.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said the partnership of 222 runs between Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England was "fabulous", considering India were 98/5. Their partnership is India's highest-ever stand for the sixth-wicket against England in Test cricket. Pant scored 146 runs while Jadeja is currently unbeaten on 83 runs.

158.title: He has put India so far ahead in the 5th Test: Agarkar on Pant's 146
158.article_body: Former India pacer Ajit Agarkar said Rishabh Pant's 146 in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England has put his team "so far ahead" in the ongoing match. "[Pant's style of play] shouldn't come as a surprise. It is...good for India that he has kept repeating it," added Agarkar. "Pant came into the Test...being...under pressure," stated Agarkar.

159.title: PM can't change my behaviour by making me sit in ED office: Rahul
159.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who was questioned recently by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case, said that PM Modi cannot change his behaviour by making him sit in the ED office for five days. "This is a confusion in...mind of the Prime Minister," he added. "My behaviour...can never be shaped by my opponents or...enemies," Rahul further said.

160.title: Manipur landslide worst incident in state's history: CM as death toll rises to 20
160.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Friday said that the landslide in Noney was the "worst incident" in the state's history. This comes as the death toll from the incident rose to 20, according to an Indian Army statement. The CM added that 81 people were lost in the landslide, of which 18 were rescued and 55 are still trapped.

161.title: Saviour has spoken: Arjun after Kartik praises trailer of Ek Villain Returns
161.article_body: Kartik Aaryan took to his Instagram Stories to praise the trailer of Arjun Kapoor's upcoming movie 'Ek Villain Returns', writing, "Superb Trailer. Killing It With The Villains. Mohit Suri sir (director) your world is fantastic as always." Arjun wrote, "Saviour has spoken," reacting to Kartik's post. Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earned more than ₹200 crore at the worldwide box office.

162.title: What multiple records did Rishabh Pant break with his 146(111) against England?
162.article_body: Rishabh Pant set the record for smashing the fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, taking 89 deliveries during the fifth Test against England. During his 111-ball 146-run knock, Pant also became the youngest Indian to reach 100 sixes in international cricket aged 24 years and 271 days. He also became the youngest wicketkeeper-batter to reach 2,000 Test runs.

163.title: What alternatives can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic banned in India?
163.article_body: The government has shared some alternatives that can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic has been banned in India. Khadi bags, bamboo straws and cutlery, stainless steel straws, fluid ear care products and reusable glasses and cups are among the alternatives. Bamboo stirrers and stainless steel lunch boxes can also be used as alternatives.

164.title: Building used as office, not residence: UP govt on Prayagraj demolition
164.article_body: Commenting on demolition of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad's house, Uttar Pradesh government said that the building was not being used for residential purposes but as the office of the Welfare Party of India. It added that the demolition was not connected to the June 10 Prayagraj violence. Javed's wife has moved Allahabad HC claiming the demolition to be illegal.

165.title: 30-yr-old man gets 1-yr jail for shouting ‘I love you’ at minor in Mumbai
165.article_body: A 30-year-old man was sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment for shouting 'I love you' at a 13-year-old girl in 2015. The convict, who lived in the girl's neighbourhood, stalked her for about 15 days. A complaint was lodged against him after he tried to come close to her while she was once returning home with her mother after buying textbooks.

166.title: Shinde, Fadnavis will bring Maha back on track of development: Scindia
166.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Friday welcomed the formation of a new government in Maharashtra under rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde. "I'm confident Shinde as CM and Devendra Fadnavis as Deputy CM will bring Maharashtra back on...road of development," Scindia added. He claimed that the previous MVA government was acting like a speed-breaker in Maharashtra's development.

167.title: Delhi Fire Services to get 89 new additional fire trucks
167.article_body: The Delhi Fire Services (DFS) will soon get 89 new additional fire trucks as the department is currently in the process of purchasing them, officials said. It will help DFS improve their response time and overcome the shortage of fire tenders, DFS Chief Atul Garg said. Notably, DFS' 60 diesel-based fire trucks have reached their expiry time of 10 years.

168.title: India reports 17,092 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,09,568
168.article_body: India has reported 17,092 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 17,070 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,09,568, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,168, according to the latest data.

169.title: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in US
169.article_body: Cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) has filed for Chapter 15 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows foreign debtors to shield US assets. Singapore-based 3AC is one of the highest-profile investors hit by the sharp sell-off in cryptocurrency markets. Notably, the company had reportedly managed an estimated $10 billion in assets as recently as March.

170.title: J&K Police help Amarnath pilgrims cross flooded bridges, share videos
170.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday shared videos of its rescue teams helping pilgrims travelling to Amarnath cave cross two bridges that had got blocked and flooded amid heavy rains. A video shows the police officers standing in a queue as they helped people cross while heavy water flowed. The bridges were located at Brari Marg and Y junction.

171.title: Hope Rocketry becomes as successful as Kashmir Files: Vivek Agnihotri
171.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to an article saying R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' has the advantage of good word-of-mouth, and is likely to repeat the success of the former's 'The Kashmir Files'. "From the bottom of my heart, I wish this happens and I'm sure it'll happen because Madhavan is one of the most honest [actors]," Vivek said.

172.title: Chef from Taj used to cook for him: Manoj Pahwa recalls eating with Rishi
172.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has said Rishi Kapoor asked him to eat with him during the shoot of 'Mulk' in Lucknow. "A chef from Taj hotel used to cook for him...Being a Kapoor, his food was spread out on the entire table," he added. "There were four types of mutton, four kinds of chicken, five kinds of sweets," Manoj further said.
