Notably, it was his personal best.

345.title: A couple of weeks ago, I was close to retirement: Rafael Nadal
345.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he was close to retirement a "couple of weeks" back, adding he has never been afraid of retirement from tennis. "It's clear that when that day comes, I will [have to] change," stated Nadal. Nadal, who is currently playing Wimbledon for the first time since the 2019 edition, admitted that "every day" is a challenge.

346.title: 2 Tanzanian nationals held with cocaine worth over ₹4 lakh in Pune
346.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested two Tanzanian nationals and recovered around 29 milligrams of cocaine, worth over ₹4 lakh, from their possession. Police had received a tip-off, following which they laid a trap and arrested the suspects. According to police, one of the suspects had come to India about two years ago and was earlier arrested in a narcotics case.

347.title: Actress Shivani Rajashekar opts out of Miss India 2022 due to college exams
347.article_body: Actress Shivani Rajashekar, daughter of veteran actors Rajasekhar and Jeevitha, recently took part in Miss India 2022 pageant and represented Tamil Nadu. However, due to college exams, she had to opt out. "Regarding my health, I'm doing much better, and in Guntur right now for my exams," she added. There won't be any representation from Tamil Nadu this year.

348.title: Indian-origin tech businessman arrested for ₹355 crore investment fraud in US
348.article_body: A 50-year-old Indian-origin tech entrepreneur has been arrested in US for a $45 million (over ₹355 crore) investment fraud in which he allegedly cheated more than 10,000 people. Neil Chandran used a group of technology firms that he owned in a scheme to defraud investors. He promised extremely high returns by claiming his companies will be acquired by wealthy buyers.

349.title: First time I saw disco was with SRK, remember looking for shoes: Manoj
349.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee recalled in an interview that the first time he ever saw a discotheque was with Shah Rukh Khan. He added that it was in Delhi in Maurya. "I still remember looking for shoes to get into the discotheque because I was in chappals," Manoj said. The two had studied acting together at Barry John Acting Studio.

350.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' team announces new Nattu Kaka, to be played by Kiran Bhatt
350.article_body: The makers of television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' have announced that theatre artist Kiran Bhatt will be portraying the character of Nattu Kaka. The character was originally portrayed by late actor Ghanshyam Nayak who passed away in October 2021 after a long battle with cancer. Kiran and Ghanshyam were friends and the former called it an emotional role.

351.title: Ukraine begins electricity exports to EU: President Zelenskyy
351.article_body: Ukraine has started exporting electricity to the European Union via Romania, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. "Thanks to Ukrainian electricity, a significant part of the Russian gas used by European consumers can be replaced...[This is therefore] not just a question of export revenue for us, it is a question of security for the whole of Europe," he added.

352.title: MS Dhoni gets knee treatment from vaidya who sits under a tree near Ranchi
352.article_body: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni is getting knee treatment from a vaidya who sits under a tree near Ranchi in Jharkhand. Dhoni has been visiting the vaidya for last one month at an interval of four days to get the treatment. "Dhoni comes like a normal patient without any pomp. He has no pride in being a celebrity," the vaidya said.

353.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; IMD releases list
353.article_body: IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall over Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha, Gujarat, Karnataka and Kerala over the next few days. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is also likely over Goa during the next four days. Isolated heavy rainfall is predicted in Jharkhand on  1st, 2nd, 3rd and 5th July.

354.title: 4 Amarnath Yatra pilgrims hurt as vehicle slips off road, overturns
354.article_body: Four pilgrims undertaking the Amarnath Yatra were injured on Friday when their vehicle slipped off a road and overturned on the national highway in the Sher Bibi area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, police said. The victims, who hail from Chhattisgarh and Uttar Pradesh, were rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment.

355.title: Rajkummar on & off camera are 2 different personalities: Sanya Malhotra
355.article_body: Sanya Malhotra, while speaking about working with Rajkummar Rao in 'HIT - The First Case' said, "Raj on set and...in front of the camera are two different personalities." "He's very passionate and...professional. Our energies matched on...set from day one," the actress added. 'HIT - The First Case' is the Hindi remake of the Telugu mystery action thriller of same name.

356.title: I'm genetically 'filmy', doctor announced my blood group as U/A: Ranbir
356.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said, "I've a bug in me...The bug of Hindi cinema." "It was obvious as my parents, grandparents and great grandparents, uncles and aunts...even my cousins are actors," he said, adding, "So I'm 'filmy' genetically...Doctor announced my blood group as U/A." U/A certificate is a censor rating given by the Central Board of Film Certification of India.

357.title: 15,000 pourakarmikas begin strike seeking permanent jobs in B'luru
357.article_body: Over 15,000 pourakarmikas (civic workers) began an indefinite strike in Bengaluru seeking permanent jobs and better pay on Friday. The pourakarmikas, waste collectors and manual labour, who keep the city clean, have also demanded dignified working conditions, safety equipment, etc. "We've been doing this work for the past 20 years but are yet to be made permanent," a pourakarmika said.

358.title: Gunmen attack Nigerian mine, kidnaps 4 Chinese nationals
358.article_body: Gunmen attacked a local mining site in northcentral Nigeria and abducted some workers, including four Chinese nationals, authorities said on Thursday. "Many security personnel" were killed in the attack, the Niger governor's office said. China in November had issued a travel advisory warning to its citizens and companies against travelling to "high-risk" areas in Nigeria and other parts of Africa.

359.title: India's playing XI for rescheduled 5th Test against England announced
359.article_body: England captain Ben Stokes won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. Team India captain Jasprit Bumrah announced that Cheteshwar Pujara will open the innings for India along with Shubman Gill. Meanwhile, Ravichandran Ashwin has not been included in the playing XI. Shardul Thakur and Ravindra Jadeja feature in the XI.

360.title: 50-year-old man jumps in front of Delhi Metro train, hospitalised
360.article_body: A 50-year-old man allegedly jumped in front of a train at Delhi's Moolchand metro station on Thursday, police said. The man, identified as Mahendar, suffered injuries in the incident and was later taken to AIIMS Trauma Centre, where he's recuperating. Meanwhile, DMRC alerted commuters about the delay in metro services from Kashmere Gate to Badarpur Border due to the incident.

361.title: Bill Gates shares his 48-year-old résumé, says 'I'm sure yours looks a lot better'
361.article_body: World's fourth-richest person Bill Gates shared his résumé from 1974 on LinkedIn and wrote, "Whether you're a recent grad or a college dropout, I'm sure your résumé looks a lot better than mine did 48 years ago." The résumé, which the Microsoft Co-founder wrote during his first year at Harvard, lists his objective as a "systems analyst or systems programmer".

362.title: Grass has right to grow & donkey has right to eat in a democracy: SC on Nupur's plea
362.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Surya Kant, while criticising Nupur Sharma for her comments on the Prophet, remarked, "In a democracy, everyone has the right to speak." He added, "In a democracy, grass has the right to grow and a donkey has the right to eat." Suspended BJP leader Nupur had sought to transfer FIRs filed against her to Delhi.

363.title: 54 kg high-grade ganja seized on Solapur-Pune highway; 2 arrested
363.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has seized 54 kilograms of high-grade ganja worth approximately ₹85 lakh on the Solapur-Pune highway, officials said. At least two persons have been arrested for peddling the contraband, that was sourced from Odisha's Ganjam. The drugs were destined for further distribution to peddlers in Mumbai, Gujarat's Surat and other adjoining areas.

364.title: Factually untrue: Edelweiss on report of firm putting its Mutual Fund business for sale
364.article_body: Edelweiss has issued a clarification after a report claimed that the company has put its Mutual Fund business for sale. In a statement, Edelweiss said, "We strongly...deny the report...the news is factually untrue and purely speculative and motivated by vested interests." It further called its MF business a "strong franchisee" and shared its growth numbers.

365.title: Woman dies by suicide a month after husband's death in Gurugram; leaves note
365.article_body: A woman allegedly died by suicide a month after her husband was killed in a road accident in Gurugram. The 32-year-old woman was found hanging at her rented accommodation in Gurugram and was undergoing a financial crisis, police said. Notably, the deceased left a five-page suicide note in which she urged her mother to take care of her 10-year-old daughter.

366.title: PMC to declare alternate day water supply due to deficit rainfall
366.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will declare a timetable for an alternate day water supply in the city from next week, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. He added that this is due to a deficit in rainfall, which has caused less availability of water in dams. "There's hardly 2.5 TMC water in...dams supplying water to the city," a civic officer said.

367.title: UP CM Adityanath launches Amazon's first Digital Kendra in UP
367.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has launched Amazon's first Digital Kendra in the state at an event in Lucknow. Amazon also signed two MoUs with MSMEs and the export promotion department of Uttar Pradesh. As part of the MoUs, Amazon will train and onboard MSMEs from the state on its Global Selling programme and export their products globally.

368.title: Ronaldo's lawyers seek $626,000 from rape accuser's lawyer in Las Vegas case
368.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's lawyers have asked a US judge to order the rape accuser's lawyer to pay the footballer $626,000 for claiming in a failed lawsuit that Ronaldo raped the woman in Las Vegas in 2009. This comes after a US judge dismissed the 2018 Nevada lawsuit, saying the alleged victim's lawyer harmed Ronaldo by conducting himself in "bad faith".

369.title: Nupur should have filed an FIR against the anchor if there was misuse of debate: SC
369.article_body: On being told by Nupur Sharma's counsel that her comments on Prophet were only in response to a fellow panellist and anchor Navika Kumar, the Supreme Court said there should've been a case against the host as well. "If there was misuse of...debate...the first thing [Nupur] should've done was to file an FIR against the anchor," the apex court said.

370.title: Some people love to take me down but they won't get me: Nick Kyrgios
370.article_body: Following a recent video where he was seen spitting in the direction of an abusive spectator during a Wimbledon 2022 match, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said, "Some people love to take me down. They won't get me." "I don't really care if there's an investigation...for what happened the other day...People do not respect me on certain occasions," added Kyrgios.

371.title: India announce 22-member squad for World Athletics Championships
371.article_body: The Athletics Federation of India (AFI) has announced a 22-member squad for the upcoming World Athletics Championships. Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra has been included in the squad. The 22-member squad includes 17 male athletes and five female athletes. Seven of the 16 athletes, who will compete in individual events, are National Record holders, the AFI stated.

372.title: ₹1.5 lakh cr wiped off Reliance's market value as govt raises export duty on fuel
372.article_body: Nearly ₹1.5 lakh crore has been wiped out from the market capitalisation of Reliance Industries after its stock declined as much as 8.7% on Friday, marking its biggest intraday drop since November 2, 2020. The shares fell after the Centre raised export duty on fuel. ONGC shares also plunged by 12.3% on Friday, its biggest slide since March 23, 2020.

373.title: 70-year-old man killed while he was asleep in Raj; at least 10 booked
373.article_body: A 70-year-old man was allegedly killed while he was asleep in his field in Rajasthan's Baran, police said. Around 10-12 locals have been booked for the alleged murder, police added. A suspect claimed the man recently electrocuted and killed one of their relatives. The victim had a fatal head injury, suggesting he was murdered with some heavy stone, police stated.

374.title: Missing 'Crypto Queen' Ruja Ignatova added to FBI's most wanted list for $4 bn fraud
374.article_body: Ruja Ignatova, also known as "Crypto Queen", has been placed on the FBI's top 10 most wanted list. Ignatova, who has been missing since 2017, is wanted for her alleged role in running a cryptocurrency scam known as OneCoin. Federal investigators accuse her of using the scheme to defraud victims out of more than $4 billion.

375.title: We are as good as married: Pavitra on relationship with Eijaz Khan
375.article_body: Actress Pavitra Punia, while speaking about her relationship with Eijaz Khan, said, "Everyone is always asking us about our marriage but honestly, we're as good as married." "When you've lived with someone for long, you stop looking at each other as boyfriend, girlfriend," she added. Pavitra further said they have been planning to marry since last year.

376.title: Russia using less precise Soviet-era missiles in Ukraine: General
376.article_body: Russia is using old Soviet-era missiles that are less accurate for more than 50% of its strikes in Ukraine, a brigadier general in Ukraine's armed forces said. Brigadier General Oleksii Hromov added that around 202 missiles had been fired on Ukraine in the second half of June, an increase of 120 from the first half of the month.

377.title: Will ensure error-free caste census in Bihar: Ex-JD(U) MP Anwar
377.article_body: Former JD(U) Rajya Sabha MP Ali Anwar has said that social organisations will ensure an error-free caste census takes place in Bihar. "Now that the caste survey is taking place, the ruling dispensation would get to know the bitter truth at home about the poor economic and educational status of a large section of the society," Anwar said.

378.title: We won't disturb new Maha govt, they must work for public: Raut
378.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has claimed that the BJP said from the first day that they'll "disturb" Uddhav Thackeray's government, however, his party "won't disturb" the new Maharashtra government. This comes after rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis were sworn in as state CM and Deputy CM respectively. "They must work for...public," Raut said.

379.title: McCullum has a gift of getting into people's heads: Ex-Eng captain Gower
379.article_body: Ex-England captain David Gower said England Test head coach Brendon McCullum has a "gift" of getting into people's heads and making them feel better. "When McCullum's appointment was announced, people were wondering what his qualifications were. They are now apparent," added Gower. Talking about England Test captain Ben Stokes, Gower stated that Stokes has a "bulletproof" approach to cricket.

380.title: 19-yr-old runs over policeman to escape checkpoint in Mumbai; arrested
380.article_body: A 19-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly ramming his two-wheeler into a 56-year-old policeman at a checkpoint in Mumbai's Wadala area on Wednesday. The youth, who was stopped for driving without helmet, ran over the policeman in an attempt to escape but was nabbed by other officials. The policeman sustained three fractures in his right shoulder and other minor injuries.

381.title: 'You Hold The Cards': Shahid Kapoor in PokerBaazi's brand film
381.article_body: PokerBaazi.com has launched a campaign 'You Hold The Cards' featuring Shahid Kapoor. The campaign aims to highlight how luck controls outcomes in life while in poker, players' skills can triumph over luck. Kapoor said, "I look forward to helping PokerBaazi reach wider audiences & create advocates for the sport,” resonating with the brand's mission of making poker a household game.

382.title: Lost out on Slumdog Millionaire as I was too good-looking for it: Gauahar
382.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan has revealed that she lost out on the Academy Award-winning movie 'Slumdog Millionaire' because she was "too good-looking for it". "He (Danny Boyle, director) said 'You're...a fab actor but somehow I won't be able to cast you...because I've to match three age groups...and I can't place you in a Slumdog Millionaire with your face'," Gauahar added.

383.title: Good to see Pujara decided to play in county cricket: Harbhajan
383.article_body: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that it's "good to see" that batter Cheteshwar Pujara picked the option of playing in England's county cricket. "He has been playing continuously in English conditions. Though you might say that in county cricket, the quality of bowlers is not like in international cricket...[But over there] you encounter one-two (international) bowlers," Singh said.

384.title: South African man charged with record $1.7 bn Bitcoin fraud in US
384.article_body: The US commodities regulator CFTC has charged a South African man and his company for operating a fraudulent commodity pool worth over $1.7 billion in Bitcoin. It is the largest fraud scheme the CFTC has ever pursued involving Bitcoin. The firm claimed to have proprietary software that would realise significant trading gains for investors who pooled their Bitcoin with it.

385.title: He raised standards of parliamentary debates: PM on VP Naidu's b'day
385.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday wished Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on his birthday and called him an "inspiration for the citizens". "As our VP, he has played a key role in raising the standards of parliamentary proceedings and debates. Praying for his long life," PM Modi tweeted. Notably, Vice President Venkaiah Naidu's term will end on August 10.

386.title: WhatsApp may get animated avatars for video calls, stickers: Report
386.article_body: WhatsApp is reportedly working on emoji-inspired avatars as its latest feature. As per a report, users can use these avatars as their profile pictures and during video calls when the camera is switched off. While the feature is still not in its final form, the avatars may also be available as stickers that can be shared within chats.

387.title: I came close to getting married thrice, all three times god saved me: Sushmita Sen
387.article_body: Opening up about marriage, actress Sushmita Sen said, "Luckily I met some very interesting men in my life, the only reason I never got married is [that] they were a let down." She added, "I came close to getting married thrice, all three times god saved me. I can't tell you what disasters followed with their respective lives."

388.title: Sushmita's brother, wife Charu to separate; he says 'Didn't know about her 1st marriage'
388.article_body: Sushmita Sen's brother Rajeev and his wife Charu Asopa are heading towards a divorce. Rajeev said he was not aware of Charu's first marriage, adding, "It was...kept hidden from us." Meanwhile, Charu said, "Not only did he know about it, but also appreciated me for moving on from my past." Rajeev and Charu tied the knot in 2019.

389.title: What has Delhi Police done? There must be red carpet for you: SC to Nupur's lawyer
389.article_body: While refusing to allow suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's plea for transferring FIRs registered against her over remarks on Prophet Muhammad to Delhi, the Supreme Court said, "What has Delhi police done...Don't make us open our mouth." After being told by her lawyer that she has joined probe, the court remarked, "Then what happened...There must have been...red carpet for you."

390.title: Afghan Sikhs arrive in Delhi, bring ashes of man killed in gurdwara attack
390.article_body: Eleven Afghan Sikhs arrived in New Delhi on Thursday less than two weeks after two people were killed in a terrorist attack on a gurdwara in Kabul. They also brought the ashes of Sawinder Singh, who was killed in the June 18 attack. The Indian government had on June 19 granted emergency e-visas to 111 Afghan Hindus and Sikhs.

391.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 2 inter-state drug peddlers, seize 25 kg ganja
391.article_body: The Hyderabad Police said that they have arrested two inter-state drug peddlers and recovered 25 kg of ganja from them. According to police, the accused have been smuggling drugs since 2020 and have ties with drug dealers in Andhra Pradesh. Based on a tip-off, the police arrested the accused on Tuesday while they were proceeding towards Borabanda from Nacharam.

392.title: Maha Guv asks CM Eknath Shinde to prove majority in Assembly on July 4
392.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked CM Eknath Shinde to prove a majority in Assembly on July 4 (Monday). A special session of the Maharashtra Assembly is scheduled to be held on July 3 and 4. The nomination for Speaker's elections will be filed on July 2 and the Speaker's elections will be held on July 3.

393.title: Instagram tests turning video posts into Reels
393.article_body: Instagram has said that it is testing a change that turns video posts into Reels. "We're testing this feature as part of our efforts to simplify and improve the video experience on Instagram," a spokesperson from Meta said. People who are part of the test will reportedly see an in-app message that says "video posts are now shared as Reels".

394.title: 30 riders booked in last 2 days for excessive bike noise in Pune
394.article_body: In a drive conducted by the Pimpri-Chinchwad Police, around 30 riders have been booked in the past two days for tinkering with their bike silencers and causing noise pollution in Pune. The riders have been booked under the Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000, police said. Notably, several residents have complained of excessive bike noise, police added.

395.title: 8-yr-old girl dies after scorpion stings her at C'garh govt school
395.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died after a scorpion stung her while she was playing at a government school in Chhattisgarh's Bemetara, officials said on Thursday. The girl was being shifted to Raipur due to her critical condition but she died on the way, officials added. On state CM's order, District Education Officer provided ₹1 lakh financial assistance to the girl's father.

396.title: Ecuador govt, indigenous groups sign deal to end 18 days of protests
396.article_body: The Ecuadorian government and indigenous groups’ leaders on Thursday signed an agreement to end 18 days of protests against soaring fuel and food prices. As part of the deal, Ecuador’s government has agreed to lower the fuel costs by 15 cents per gallon. The deal also sets limits on the expansion of oil exploration areas and restricts certain mining activities.

397.title: Mom was very happy with me playing a sardar in 'Rocket Singh': Ranbir
397.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, while speaking about his 2009 film 'Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year', said, "This film broke my heart when it didn't do well." "My mother was very happy with me playing a sardar because she's a sardarni," he added. Ranbir further said he meets a lot of people who appreciate the film and his character in the film.

398.title: 4 carry weapons in bid to rob people near Pune rly station, held
398.article_body: Pune police arrested four persons, aged between 19 and 29, who were planning to rob people near the city's railway station. The incident occurred on Wednesday and the accused were carrying weapons and chilli powder, officials said. "Our team laid a trap near station where we nabbed them, but one of the gang members fled the spot," an official said.

399.title: Eng will win 5th Test, India would've won the series last year: Moeen
399.article_body: England all-rounder Moeen Ali said they "will win" the rescheduled fifth Test of the series against India which they trail 1-2 as India are "undercooked". "If this series had finished off last year, India would have won it," added Moeen. The Test series initially started in 2021 with the fifth Test cancelled due to COVID-19 fears and eventually rescheduled.

400.title: Received a love letter: Pawar on IT notices regarding election affidavits
400.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday tweeted that he has received notices from Income Tax (IT) department over his election affidavits in 2004, 2009, 2014 and 2020. "This device is utilised against those who hold views different than those of the Centre. I have received such a love letter," Pawar wrote. Notably, Eknath Shinde became Maharashtra's new CM on Thursday.

401.title: RIL shares fall by 5%, its biggest decline in 18 months after govt raises fuel excise duty
401.article_body: After the Centre announced an increase in taxes on the export of petrol, diesel, and aviation turbine fuel (ATF), shares of Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL), ONGC and Oil India witnessed a decline. While RIL shares plunged over 5% in its biggest decline in about 18 months, shares of ONGC dropped by 10% during intraday trade on Friday.
